hook.text: Amazon lost money for seven straight years. Investors begged Bezos to show profit. He refused. The flywheel took over.

buildup.text: Strategic patience is the discipline to stay the course when results lag. Trust the process while the world doubts.

discovery.text: Collins' flywheel: consistent effort in one direction compounds. The breakthrough comes not from one push but from many.

twist.text: Patience without adaptation is stubbornness. The art is knowing when to wait for strategy to work and when to pivot.

climax.text: Leaders build patience with leading indicators, celebrating progress, and shielding long-term bets from short-term fear.

punchline.text: Impatience kills more strategies than bad planning does.

quiz.question: What is the flywheel effect?
options: Rapid success from a single big decision
